original: Sacepāyasmā puttadāresu apekkhaṁ karissati, marissateva;
analyzed: sace ipa ayasmā putta dāresu apekkham karissati marissatā iva
translated: If he does, he will die anyway;

original: no cepāyasmā puttadāresu apekkhaṁ karissati, marissateva.
analyzed: no cepa ayasmā putta dāresu apekkham karissati marissatā iva
translated: if he doesn’t, he will die anyway.

original: Sādhāyasmā, yā te puttadāresu apekkhā taṁ pajahā’ti.
analyzed: sādha ayasmai yā te putta dāresu apekkhā tam pajahāti
translated: It would be good if you would give up your concern for your children and wife.’

original: So ce evaṁ vadeyya:
analyzed: sā u ced evam vadeyya
translated: If he says,

original: ‘yā me puttadāresu apekkhā sā pahīnā’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo:
analyzed: yā me putta dāresu apekkhā sā pahīnā ati saḥ evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: ‘I have given up my concern for my children and wife,’ he should be told,

original: ‘atthi panāyasmato mānusakesu pañcasu kāmaguṇesu apekkhā’ti?
analyzed: atthi pana āyasmataḥ mānusakesu pañcasu kāmaguṇesu
translated: ‘But do you have any concern for the five cords of sensual pleasure of the human realm?’

original: So ce evaṁ vadeyya:
analyzed: sā u ced evam vadeyya
translated: If he says,

original: ‘atthi me mānusakesu pañcasu kāmaguṇesu apekkhā’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo:
analyzed: atthi me mānusakesu pañcasu kāmaguṇesu so evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: ‘I have concern for the five cords of sensual pleasure of the human realm,’ he should be told,

original: ‘mānusakehi kho, āvuso, kāmehi dibbā kāmā abhikkantatarā ca paṇītatarā ca.
analyzed: mānusakehi kho āvuso kāmehi dibbāḥ kāmāḥ abhikkantatarāḥ ca paṇītatarāḥ ca
translated: ‘Friend, sensual pleasures of the divine realm are more excellent and sublime than those of the human realm.

original: Sādhāyasmā, mānusakehi kāmehi cittaṁ vuṭṭhāpetvā cātumahārājikesu devesu cittaṁ adhimocehī’ti.
analyzed: sādha ayasmai mānusakehi kāmehi cittam vuṭṭhāpetvā cātumahārājikesu devesu cittam adhimocehi iti
translated: It would be good if you would give up your concern for the five cords of sensual pleasure of the human realm and resolve on the devas who control the magical powers that are produced at will in the Four Great Kings’ retinue.’

original: So ce evaṁ vadeyya:
analyzed: sā u ced evam vadeyya
translated: If he says,

original: ‘mānusakehi me kāmehi cittaṁ vuṭṭhitaṁ, cātumahārājikesu devesu cittaṁ adhimocitan’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo:
analyzed: mānusakehi me kāmehi cittam vuṭṭhita cātumahārājikesu devesu cittam adhimocitan ti saḥ evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: ‘My mind has left behind the human and is now intent on the gods of the Four Great Kings,’ he should be told:

original: ‘cātumahārājikehi kho, āvuso, devehi tāvatiṁsā devā abhikkantatarā ca paṇītatarā ca.
analyzed: cātumahārājikehi kho āvuso devehi tāvatisāḥ devāḥ abhikkantatarā ca paṇītatarā ca
translated: ‘The gods of the Thirty-three are more excellent and sublime than the gods of the Four Great Kings.

original: Sādhāyasmā, cātumahārājikehi devehi cittaṁ vuṭṭhāpetvā tāvatiṁsesu devesu cittaṁ adhimocehī’ti.
analyzed: cātumahārājikehi devehi cittam vuṭṭhāpetvā tāvatisesu devesu cittam adhimocehi iti
translated: It would be good if you would leave behind the gods of the Four Great Kings and direct your mind to the gods of the Thirty-three.’

original: So ce evaṁ vadeyya:
analyzed: sā u ced evam vadeyya
translated: If he says,

original: ‘cātumahārājikehi me devehi cittaṁ vuṭṭhitaṁ, tāvatiṁsesu devesu cittaṁ adhimocitan’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo:
analyzed: cātumahārājikehi me devehi cittam vuṭṭhita tāvatisesu devesu cittam adhimocitanti saḥ evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: ‘My mind has left behind the gods of the Four Great Kings and is now intent on the gods of the Thirty-three,’ he should be told:

original: ‘tāvatiṁsehi kho, āvuso, devehi yāmā devā …pe…
analyzed: khalu āvuso devehi yāmāḥ devāḥ pe
translated: ‘The Yāma gods are more excellent and sublime than the gods of the Thirty-three. …🔽The Tusita gods are more excellent and sublime than the Yāma gods. …

original: tusitā devā …pe…🔽nimmānaratī devā …pe…
analyzed: tusitā devā pe  nimmāna ratī devā pe
translated: The gods who delight in creating are more excellent and sublime than the Tusita gods. …

original: paranimmitavasavattī devā …pe…
analyzed: devā pe
translated: The gods who control the creations of others are more excellent and sublime than the gods who delight in creating. …

original: paranimmitavasavattīhi kho, āvuso, devehi brahmaloko abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca.
analyzed: paranimmitavasavattīhi kho āvuso devehi brahma lokaḥ abhikkantataraḥ ca paṇītataraḥ ca
translated: The Brahmā worlds are more excellent and sublime than the gods who control the creations of others.

original: Sādhāyasmā, paranimmitavasavattīhi devehi cittaṁ vuṭṭhāpetvā brahmaloke cittaṁ adhimocehī’ti.🔽So ce evaṁ vadeyya:
analyzed: sādha ayasman paranimmitavasavattīhi devehi cittam vuṭṭhāpetvā brahma loke cittam adhimocehi iti  sā u ced evam vadeyya
translated: It would be good if you would lift your mind away from the Paranimmitavasavatti gods and direct it to the Brahma world.’

original: ‘paranimmitavasavattīhi me devehi cittaṁ vuṭṭhitaṁ, brahmaloke cittaṁ adhimocitan’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo:
analyzed: paranimmitavasavattīhi me devehi cittam vuṭṭhita brahmaloke cittam adhimocitanti saḥ evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: If he says, ‘My mind has lifted away from the Paranimmitavasavatti gods and is directed to the Brahma world,’

original: ‘brahmalokopi kho, āvuso, anicco addhuvo sakkāyapariyāpanno.
analyzed: brahma lokaḥ api kho āvuso aniccaḥ addhuvaḥ sakkāya pariyāpanno
translated: he should be told, ‘The Brahma world is impermanent, unstable, and subject to change.

original: Sādhāyasmā, brahmalokā cittaṁ vuṭṭhāpetvā sakkāyanirodhe cittaṁ upasaṁharāhī’ti.🔽So ce evaṁ vadeyya:
analyzed: sādha ayasmai brahma lokā cittam vuṭṭhāpetvā sakkāya nirodhe cittam upasaharāhi iti  sā u ced evam vadeyya
translated: It would be good if you would lift your mind away from the Brahma world and direct it to the cessation of identity.’

original: ‘brahmalokā me cittaṁ vuṭṭhitaṁ, sakkāyanirodhe cittaṁ upasaṁharāmī’ti;🔽evaṁ vimuttacittassa kho, mahānāma, upāsakassa āsavā vimuttacittena bhikkhunā na kiñci nānākaraṇaṁ vadāmi, yadidaṁ—
analyzed: brahma lokāḥ me cittam vuṭṭhita sakkāya nirodhe cittam upasaharāmi iti  evam vimutta cittassa kho mahānāma upāsakassa āsavāḥ vimutta cittena bhikkhunā na kiñci nānākaraṇam vadāmi yat idam
translated: If he says, ‘My mind has lifted away from the Brahma world and is directed to the cessation of identity,’🔽then I say there is no difference at all between a lay follower whose mind is liberated like this and a bhikkhu whose mind is liberated.

original: vimuttiyā vimuttan”ti.🔽Catutthaṁ.
analyzed: vimuttiyāḥ vimuttanti  catuttha
translated: There is no difference between them in terms of perfect insight.”🔽The fourth section on the Brahma world is finished.
